item.title: New Mexico CAFO General Permit Fact Sheet
item.description:
A fact sheet about the reissuance of the Concentrated Animal Feeding Operations (CAFO) National Pollutant Discharge Eliminination System (NPDES) General Permit for New Mexico, including changes from the 2009 permit.

  • New Mexico CAFO General Permit Fact Sheet (PDF)(30 pp, 378 K, July 7, 2016)
item.dc:creator: cfanning

item.title: NPDES General Permit for Discharges from CAFOs in New Mexico
item.description:
This permit offers National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit coverage for discharges from operations defined as concentrated animal feeding operations (CAFOs) in the State of New Mexico (except on Indian Country and as excluded in Part I of the permit).  It is effective immediately and shall expire at midnight on July 13, 2021.

  • NPDES General Permit for Discharges from CAFOs in New Mexico (PDF)(66 pp, 309 K, July 14, 2016)
item.dc:creator: cfanning

item.title: Response to Comments on the Proposed NPDES General Permit for Discharges from CAFOs in New Mexico
item.description:
Responses to comments received on the draft permit proposed December 2014. Responses include substantive changes, application and eligibility, effluent limitations and standards, and more.

  • Response to Comments on the Proposed NPDES General Permit for Discharges from CAFOs in New Mexico (PDF)(27 pp, 490 K, July 2106)
item.dc:creator: cfanning

item.title: New Mexico NPDES General CAFO Permit Pre-Publication Federal Register Notice
item.description:
This notice has been signed and sent for publication, but may not yet be published. It is provided to give the most possible advance notice of changes to regulations. 

EPA is reissuing a National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) general permit for eligible discharges from concentrated animal feeding operations (CAFOs) in New Mexico, except those discharges on Indian Country. This permit covers animal feeding operations that are defined as CAFOs or designated as CAFOs by the permitting authority and that are subject to 40 CFR part 412, subparts A (Horses) and C (Dairy Cows and Cattle Other than Veal Calves) and that discharge or propose to discharge pollutants to waters of the United States. A CAFO proposes to discharge if it is designed, constructed, operated, or maintained such that a discharge will occur.

  • Final National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) General Permit For Discharges From Concentrated Animal Feeding Operations (CAFOs) In New Mexico (NMG010000) (PDF)(4 pp, 69 K, July 14, 2016)
item.dc:creator: cfanning
